verses.verse: Sarah <S%H8283><s%> lived <S%H2416><s%> one <S%H3967><s%> hundred <S%H6242><s%> twenty-seven <S%H7651><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%> This was the length <S%H8141><s%> of Sarah <S%H8283><s%>'s life. <S%H2416><s%>

Sarah <S%H8283><s%> died <S%H4191><s%> in Kiriath <S%H7153><s%> Arba <S%H2275><s%> (the same is Hebron), in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to mourn <S%H5594><s%> for Sarah, <S%H8283><s%> and to weep for her. <S%H1058><s%>
Abraham <S%H85><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> from before <S%H6440><s%> his dead, <S%H4191><s%> and spoke <S%H1696><s%> to the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"I am a stranger <S%H1616><s%> and a foreigner <S%H8453><s%> living with you. <S%H5414><s%> Give me a possession <S%H272><s%> of a burying-place <S%H6913><s%> with you, <S%H6912><s%> that I may bury my dead <S%H4191><s%> out of my sight. <S%H6440><s%>"
The children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth <S%H2845><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Abraham, <S%H85><s%> saying to him, <S%H559><s%>

"Hear us, <S%H8085><s%> my lord. <S%H113><s%> You are a prince <S%H5387><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> among us. <S%H8432><s%> Bury <S%H6912><s%> your dead <S%H4191><s%> in the best <S%H4005><s%> of our tombs. <S%H6913><s%> None <S%H3808><s%> of us will withhold <S%H3607><s%> from you his tomb. <S%H6913><s%> Bury <S%H6912><s%> your dead. <S%H4191><s%>"
Abraham <S%H85><s%> rose up, <S%H6965><s%> and bowed <S%H7812><s%> himself to the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> even to the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth. <S%H2845><s%>

He talked <S%H1696><s%> with them, <S%H559><s%> saying, "If it be <S%H3426><s%> your mind <S%H5315><s%> that I should bury <S%H6912><s%> my dead <S%H4191><s%> out of my sight, <S%H6440><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> me, <S%H6293><s%> and entreat for me to Ephron <S%H6085><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Zohar, <S%H6714><s%>

that he may give <S%H5414><s%> me the cave <S%H4631><s%> of Machpelah, <S%H4375><s%> which he has, <S%H7097><s%> which is in the end of his field. <S%H7704><s%> For the full <S%H4392><s%> price <S%H3701><s%> let him give it <S%H5414><s%> to me among you <S%H8432><s%> for a possession <S%H272><s%> of a burying-place. <S%H6913><s%>"

Now Ephron <S%H6085><s%> was sitting <S%H3427><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth. <S%H2845><s%> Ephron <S%H6085><s%> the Hittite <S%H2850><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> in the hearing <S%H241><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> even of all who went in <S%H935><s%> at the gate <S%H8179><s%> of his city, <S%H5892><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"No, <S%H113><s%> my lord, hear me. <S%H8085><s%> I <S%H5414><s%> give you the field, <S%H7704><s%> and I <S%H5414><s%> give you the cave <S%H4631><s%> that is in it. <S%H5414><s%> In the presence <S%H5869><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> I give <S%H5414><s%> it to you. <S%H6912><s%> Bury your dead. <S%H4191><s%>"
Abraham <S%H85><s%> bowed himself down <S%H7812><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%>

He spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Ephron <S%H6085><s%> in the audience <S%H241><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "But if you <S%H3863><s%> will, <S%H8085><s%> please hear me. <S%H5414><s%> I will give the price <S%H3701><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%> Take <S%H3947><s%> it from me, <S%H6912><s%> and I will bury my dead there. <S%H4191><s%>"
Ephron <S%H6085><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Abraham, <S%H85><s%> saying to him, <S%H559><s%>

"My lord, <S%H113><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me. <S%H776><s%> What is a piece of land worth four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> between <S%H996><s%> me and you? <S%H6912><s%> Therefore bury your dead. <S%H4191><s%>"

Abraham <S%H85><s%> listened <S%H8085><s%> to Ephron. <S%H6085><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> weighed <S%H8254><s%> to Ephron <S%H6085><s%> the silver <S%H3701><s%> which he had named <S%H1696><s%> in the audience <S%H241><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver, <S%H3701><s%> according to the current <S%H5674><s%> merchants <S%H5503><s%>' standard.

So the field <S%H7704><s%> of Ephron, <S%H6085><s%> which was in Machpelah, <S%H4375><s%> which was before <S%H6440><s%> Mamre, <S%H4471><s%> the field, <S%H7704><s%> the cave <S%H4631><s%> which was in it, <S%H6086><s%> and all the trees that were in the field, <S%H7704><s%> that were in all of its <S%H5439><s%> borders, <S%H1366><s%> were deeded <S%H6965><s%>

to Abraham <S%H85><s%> for a possession <S%H4736><s%> in the presence <S%H5869><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> before all who went in <S%H935><s%> at the gate <S%H8179><s%> of his city. <S%H5892><s%>

After <S%H310><s%> this, <S%H3651><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> buried <S%H6912><s%> Sarah <S%H8283><s%> his wife <S%H802><s%> in the cave <S%H4631><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> of Machpelah <S%H4375><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Mamre <S%H4471><s%> (that is, <S%H2275><s%> Hebron), in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan. <S%H3667><s%>

The field, <S%H7704><s%> and the cave <S%H4631><s%> that is in it, <S%H6965><s%> were deeded to Abraham <S%H85><s%> for a possession <S%H272><s%> of a burying place <S%H6913><s%> by the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth. <S%H2845><s%>
